title: Exponential Growth - Bacteria Culture - Part C

content.description:
Time

(hours)
 <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>0</mn> </math>
 <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>1</mn> </math>
 <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>2</mn> </math>

Area

(square centimeters)
 <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mn>0.4</mn></mrow> </math>
 <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mn>0.6</mn> </mrow> </math>
 <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mn>0.9</mn></mrow> </math>

A bacteria culture is grown in a petri dish. The table gives the area of the culture, in square centimeters, at various times, in hours, since the beginning of an experiment. The area of the bacteria culture is proportional to the actual number of bacteria in the culture.

The area of the bacteria culture can be modeled by the function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>C</mi> </math> given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>C</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup> <mi>b</mi> <mi>t</mi> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D5A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>C</mi><mtext>â€Š</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadoeacaaMi8UaaiikaiaadshacaGGPaaaaa@3AF2@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is the area, in square centimeters, at time <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>t</mi> </math> hours since the beginning of the experiment.
content.question:
Part C

Does the model found in Part A demonstrate exponential growth or exponential decay? Give a reason for your answer.

frqParts.text:
Part C

Does the model found in Part A demonstrate exponential growth or exponential decay? Give a reason for your answer.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
